newsitem.title: USA: May Department April same-store sales up.
newsitem.headline: May Department April same-store sales up.

text.p: May Department Stores Co said Thursday its same store sales for the four-weeks ended May 3 rose three percent.
Total sales for April increased 8.7 percent to $838.1 million from $771.0 million.
Sales were helped by the addition of a weekend selling day as Easter Sunday was in fiscal March 1997 versus fiscal April last year, May said.
Sales for the first quarter of fiscal 1997 were $2.59 billion, up 7.6 percent from $2.40 billion a year ago. Same store first quarter sales rose 1.9 percent.

Sales have been restated to exclude stores that have been closed and not replaced. Year-to-date revenues, including sales of non-replaced closed stores and finance charge revenues, were $2.67 billion in 1997 and $2.51 billion in 1996.
May operates 366 department stores in 30 states and the District of Columbia.
